docs.summary: Deletes a label from the site and removes it from contacts it applies to.
description: The `deleteLabel()` function returns a Promise that resolves when the specified label is deleted.

examples.title: Delete a label (export from backend code)

params.name: displayName
params.doc:
Display name to retrieve or create.

If an existing label is an exact match
for the specified display name,
the existing label is returned.
If not, a new label is created and returned.

ret.doc: Label that was found or created.

docs.summary: Retrieves a label with a given name, or creates one if it doesn't exist.
description:
The `findOrCreateLabel()` function returns a Promise that resolves when the specified label is found or created.

Successful calls to `findOrCreateLabel()` always returns a label, which can be passed to subsequent function calls.

To find an existing label without potentially creating a new one, use `getLabel()` or `queryLabels()`.

examples.title: Create a label (dashboard page code)
body: console.log('Successfully created a new label:', newLabel);

examples.title: Create a label (export from backend code)
body: console.log('Successfully created a new label:', newLabel);

examples.title: Create a new label and add it to a contact
body: export const addNewLabelToContact = webMethod(Permissions.Anyone, async (displayName, contactId) => {
return "Label was not added to contact.";

extra.description: This function creates a new label, gets the label's key, and then adds the label to the contact.

params.name: key
params.doc:
Label key.

`key` is generated when the label is created.
It cannot be modified, even if `displayName` is updated.

docs.summary: Retrieves a label by the specified label key.
description: The `getLabel()` function returns a Promise that resolves when the specified label is retrieved.

examples.title: Get a specified label (dashboard page code)
Get a specified label (export from backend code)
Get the display name for a specified label
body: console.log('successfully retrieved the display name:', displayName);

examples.title: Get the display name for a specified label
body: console.log('successfully retrieved the display name:', displayName);

docs.summary: Creates a query to retrieve a list of labels.
description: The `queryLabels()` function builds a query to retrieve a list of labels and returns a `LabelsQueryBuilder` object.
The returned object contains the query definition, which is used to run the query using the `find()` function.
You can refine the query by chaining `LabelsQueryBuilder` functions onto the query. `LabelsQueryBuilder` functions enable you to filter, sort, and control the results that `queryLabels()` returns.
`queryLabels()` runs with the following `LabelsQueryBuilder` defaults, which you can override:
The following `LabelsQueryBuilder` functions are supported for `queryLabels()`. For a full description of the `Labels` object, see the object returned for the `items` property in `LabelsQueryResult`.

description: The `renameLabel()` function returns a Promise that resolves when the specified label's display name is changed.

members.name: _createdDate
members.doc: Date and time the label was created.

members.name: _updatedDate
members.doc: Date and time the label was last updated.

members.name: displayName
members.doc: Label display name shown in the Dashboard.

members.name: key
members.doc:
Label key.

`key` is generated when the label is created.
It cannot be modified, even if `displayName` is updated.

members.name: labelType
members.doc:
Label type.

- `"SYSTEM"`: The label is a default system label for the Contact List.
- `"USER_DEFINED"`: The label was created by a site contributor or 3rd-party app.
- `"WIX_APP_DEFINED"`: The label was created by a Wix app.

members.name: namespace
members.doc:
Label namespace.

Labels created by site admins or 3rd-party apps
are automatically assigned to the `custom` namespace.

members.name: namespaceDisplayName
members.doc:
Display name for the namespace,
used to organize the list of labels in the site Dashboard.

description: Label that was found or created.

members.name: displayName
members.doc: Namespace display name

members.name: key
members.doc: Namespace key

members.name: key
members.doc: Label key to delete.

members.name: _id
members.doc:
Unique event ID.
Allows clients to ignore duplicate webhooks.

members.name: entityEventSequence
members.doc:
A sequence number defining the order of updates to the underlying entity.
For example, given that some entity was updated at 16:00 and than again at 16:01,
it is guaranteed that the sequence number of the second update is strictly higher than the first.
As the consumer, you can use this value to ensure that you handle messages in the correct order.
To do so, you will need to persist this number on your end, and compare the sequence number from the
message against the one you have stored. Given that the stored number is higher, you should ignore the message.

members.name: entityFqdn
members.doc:
Assumes actions are also always typed to an entity_type
Example: wix.stores.catalog.product, wix.bookings.session, wix.payments.transaction

members.name: entityId
members.doc: ID of the entity associated with the event.

members.name: eventTime
members.doc: Event timestamp.

members.name: originatedFrom
members.doc: If present, indicates the action that triggered the event.

members.name: slug
members.doc:
This is top level to ease client code dispatching of messages (switch on entity_fqdn+slug)
This is although the created/updated/deleted notion is duplication of the oneof types
Example: created/updated/deleted/started/completed/email_opened

members.name: triggeredByAnonymizeRequest
members.doc:
Whether the event was triggered as a result of a privacy regulation application
(for example, GDPR).

members.name: deletedEntityAsJson
members.doc: Entity that was deleted

members.name: currentEntityAsJson
members.doc:
Since platformized APIs only expose PATCH and not PUT we can't assume that the fields sent from the client are the actual diff.
This means that to generate a list of changed fields (as opposed to sent fields) one needs to traverse both objects.
We don't want to impose this on all developers and so we leave this traversal to the notification recipients which need it.

members.name: newLabel
members.doc:
Indicates whether the label was just created or already existed.

If the label was just created, returns `true`.
If it already existed, returns `false`.

members.name: limit
members.doc:
Number of items to return. Defaults to `1000`.
Maximum: `2000`.

members.name: offset
members.doc: Number of items to skip in the current sort order.

members.name: count
members.doc: Number of items returned.

members.name: offset
members.doc: Requested offset.

members.name: tooManyToCount
members.doc:
Indicates if `total` calculation timed out before the response was sent.
Typically this happens if there is a large set of results.

members.name: total
members.doc: Number of items that matched the query.

members.name: sort
members.doc:
Sorting options. For a list of fields that can be sorted, see [sorting and filtering for labels](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/contacts/labels/sort-and-filter).

Example: `{ "sort": [{"fieldName": "displayName", "order": "DESC"}] }`
